page.title: 10ST.PETERS CHURCH SPIRE
page.content: St.Peter's Newdigate,Church Spire Shingles Project,was carried out between 1978-1985.Ernie Harris,a retired shingles maker from Leicestershire,taught two local craftsmen,Paul and Andrew Wright,to cleave shingles.Inaddition to their normal work they made 15,000 oak shingles in five years.Oak shingles cleaved with the grain have a stable and waterproof quality. Two charitable trusts,the Department of the Enviroment,together with past and present residents raised the necessarymoney. The steeplejack,Peter Harknett,renowned for his skill,dexterity and pride in his work pointed out,"it is unique in this century for a church spire to be clad in oak shingles made locally by local craftsmen from local trees."
